title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of coin using variables. The number of nickels is five more than two times the number of quarters, so you can represent as $$2q+5$$, and write pennies simply as q.
speech: Represent the number of each type of coin using variables. The number of nickels is five more than two times the number of quarters, so you can represent as , 2 q plus 5 , and write pennies simply as q.
pacedSpeech: Represent the number of each type of coin using variables. The number of nickels is five more than two times the number of quarters, so you can represent as  , 2 q plus 5
, and write pennies simply as q.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiple the number of each coin type(in variable form) by its respective value.
speech: Multiple the number of each coin type(in variable form) by its respective value.
pacedSpeech: Multiple the number of each coin type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their coin values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{0.05}\left(2q+5\right)+0.25q=6.55$$.
speech: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their coin values into a single equation. This will be  0.05 of, parentheses, 2 q plus 5,  plus 0.25 q is equal to 6.55 .

title: Substitution
text: Plug q into the original relationship between the coins to find $$2q+5$$.
speech: Plug q into the original relationship between the coins to find , 2 q plus 5, .
pacedSpeech: Plug q into the original relationship between the coins to find  , 2 q plus 5,

title: Calculation
text: The answer is $$41$$ nickels and $$18$$ quarters.
speech: The answer is  41  nickels and  18  quarters.
